medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic nasal congestion, tinnitus, and bilateral conduction and sensorineural hearing loss.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began over 8 months ago with chronic nasal congestion and hearing loss. After 4 months, fever developed, persisting for over 4 months, accompanied by excessive weight loss exceeding 8 kg. After treatment with intravenous methylprednisolone, symptoms improved but fever relapsed after 3 months of glucocorticoid maintenance treatment, with fluctuations in body temperature and new symptoms of migraine and stuffiness in the right ear.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was diagnosed with chronic nephritis 20 years ago.
medical_history.social_history: The patient had a history of raising parrots 1 year ago.
